results.title: Learning to jump
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horses: basics to eventing”.
Shows training of horse and rider to jump beginning with poles laid out on the ground and progressing through to a series of jumps.

results.title: The Mole and the chewing gum
results.creator_credit: Zdenek Miler, H. Kilianove, H. Mauricova, J. Forman and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated film about a mole who discovers some chewing gum and gets into a sticky situation. Story by J. A. Novotny. Music by Milos Vacek. Animated by J. Doubrava, O. Kudrnac, K. Stebl, V. Maresova, Z. Bartova and J. Vokoun.

results.title: How Mole got his trousers
results.creator_credit: Zdenek Miler, Kratky Film and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Mole desires a pair of trousers and sets about making a pair with the help of other animal, bird and insect friends. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: Drugs: it's up to you really
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Lesley Hammond, Nicholas Cockram, South Australian Film Corporation and Telefeatures
results.brief_description: Groups of students talk about their own experiences with drugs, their attitudes towards drugs and the influences upon them to take various drugs especially cigarettes, alcohol and analgesics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Nottage, Lesley Hammond, Nicholas Cockram, South Australian Film Corporation and Telefeatures

results.title: The ABC of unions
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A group of high school students, reacting against their harsh music master, devise an analogous story about why there are trade unions. They learn all about arbitration, bargaining and compromise. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Green machine (Plants)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Coverage of the life of a green plant. The work involved in the plant producing its own food is discussed as it the importance of this process to an overall understanding of ecology. Implications for the future with respect to harvesting energy and food with this process are also raised.

results.title: Tracks on the Oregon trail
results.creator_credit: Christopher Riley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
Shows how strong government legislation has been largely responsible for the clean-up of Oregon’s rivers, roadside litter and air pollution problems.
Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: New sound of music
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This BBC documentary narrated and presented by Michael Rodd demonstrates a sample of technology and technique musicians and sound recordists have used to come up with a “new sound in music”. The use of early oscillation and voltage control sound effects, computers, music synthesisers, multi-track-recording techniques, including tape manipulation are shown. Some early-automated musical instruments such as the Pianola and a programmed mechanical robotic violin are also seen. The presenter demonstrates how the electronic music theme to “Dr Who” was created in the BBC’s Radiophonic Workshop and other musical themes for television are shown in their creation. Archival footage showing a stage performance of an unattended computer that can make unique musical composition choices is included along with its inventor Peter Zinovieff (the founder of EMS: Electronic Music Studios) at home in his studio. Musician and inventor David Voorhaus demonstrates the “Maniac”, a unique analogue sequencer and an instrument that uses magnetic tape in the place of strings he created.
